title: Vintage Sewing Machines
description: Test your knowledge of the sewing machines that helped families make and mend their clothes

questions.question: Which sewing machine brand, founded by Isaac Singer in 1851, became the most recognized name in home sewing?
What powered early treadle sewing machines before electricity was common in homes?
options: A foot-operated pedal and rocking plate

questions.question: What was the Singer Featherweight, model 221, especially prized for when it was introduced in 1933?
What piece of furniture was a sewing machine commonly built into, with a fold-down top that concealed the machine?
What did many women make at home using a sewing machine and paper patterns from companies like McCall's and Simplicity?
What feature, added to sewing machines in the 1950s, allowed for decorative stitches like zigzag patterns?
What tool was essential for removing stitching mistakes when sewing?
What small, spool-shaped component holds the lower thread inside the sewing machine?
What pattern company, founded in 1863, was known for its illustrated pattern envelopes showing fashionable designs?
What was the common term for the foot-controlled speed regulator on an electric sewing machine?
options: A foot pedal or foot controller

questions.question: What sewing accessory, worn on the finger, protected against needle pricks when hand-sewing?
What Singer innovation allowed women to buy expensive sewing machines through small weekly payments, one of the first installment plans?
What European sewing machine brand, founded in Switzerland in 1893, became known for its precision engineering and durability?
What fabric store chain, founded in 1943, became the go-to destination for home sewers buying patterns, fabric, and notions?
What was the decorative gold or black scrollwork design found on many vintage Singer sewing machines called?
